org.fluidity.features

Interface Scheduler.Task.Control

  • Enclosing interface:
    Scheduler.Task

    public static interface Scheduler.Task.Control
    Controls an invocation scheduled by the invoke() methods of a Scheduler.

    Usage

    See Scheduler.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean cancel()
      Cancels any subsequent scheduled invocation of the task this control corresponds to.
      boolean canceled()
      Tells if the task has been canceled, either manually or due to the task having thrown an Error.
      AtomicInteger exceptionLimit()
      Returns the exception limit, which is the number of consecutive invocations throwing an exception that will cause the task to be suspended.
      AtomicLong penaltyTime()
      The time in milliseconds a task suspended due to too many consecutive invocations throwing an exception will be suspended for.
      void resume()
      Resumes a suspended task.
      void suspend()
      Suspends the task.
      boolean suspended()
      Tells if the task is suspended or not.

    • Method Detail

      • suspend

        void suspend()
        Suspends the task. A task suspended by calling this method is not invoked until resumed again. If the task was scheduled for a single invocation and that single invocation happened while the task was suspended, then the task will be invoked when it is resumed.

      • resume

        void resume()
        Resumes a suspended task. The task may be suspended by calling suspend() or by it throwing some exception in exceptionLimit() consecutive invocations.

      • suspended

        boolean suspended()
        Tells if the task is suspended or not. The task may be suspended by calling suspend() or by it throwing some exception in exceptionLimit() consecutive invocations.
        Returns:
        true if the task is suspended, false otherwise.

      • exceptionLimit

        AtomicInteger exceptionLimit()
        Returns the exception limit, which is the number of consecutive invocations throwing an exception that will cause the task to be suspended. A suspended task is not invoked until it is resumed or until a penalty time is elapsed.

        The default exception limit is specified using the Scheduler.TASK_EXCEPTION_LIMIT property; see Scheduler for details.

        Returns:
        an atomically mutable integer that can be used to set or query the exception limit.

      • penaltyTime

        AtomicLong penaltyTime()
        The time in milliseconds a task suspended due to too many consecutive invocations throwing an exception will be suspended for. If the task throws an exception again after the penalty time, it is again suspended for the penalty time.

        The default penalty time is specified using the Scheduler.TASK_EXCEPTION_PENALTY property; see Scheduler for details.

        Returns:
        an atomically mutable long that can be used to set or query the penalty time.

      • canceled

        boolean canceled()
        Tells if the task has been canceled, either manually or due to the task having thrown an Error.
        Returns:
        true if the task has been canceled, false otherwise.

      • cancel

        boolean cancel()
        Cancels any subsequent scheduled invocation of the task this control corresponds to.
        Returns:
        true if the call prevented one or more scheduled executions from taking place; false otherwise.
